alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 09 at 1:58PM CST until December 09 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN DESOTO...EAST CENTRAL TUNICA AND NORTHWESTERN TATE COUNTIES... At 158 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Little Texas, or 18 miles west of Senatobia, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Coldwater, Tunica, Arkabutla, Phillipp, Dubbs, Little Texas, North Tunica, Dooley, Savage, Frees Corners, Prichard, Evansville, and Trinity. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
